actions.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 86-12. Record Vote No: 228.

official_title: A resolution to appoint a special independent counsel to investigate, utilizing the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the General Accounting Office, and any other Government department or agency as may be appropriate, recent unauthorized disclosures of nonpublic confidential information.
subjects: Advice and consent of the Senate

summary.text: Establishes an Office of Temporary Special Independent Counsel, to be directed by a special independent counsel, to investigate, utilizing the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the General Accounting Office, and any other Government department or agency as may be appropriate, unauthorized disclosures of nonpublic confidential information during the Clarence Thomas Supreme Court confirmation hearings and the Charles Keating investigation. Directs the counsel to report investigation findings to the Majority and Minority Leaders for appropriate action.

titles.title: A resolution to appoint a special independent counsel to investigate, utilizing the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the General Accounting Office, and any other Government department or agency as may be appropriate, recent unauthorized disclosures of nonpublic confidential information.
